intro: Ramonia pulchella, commonly known as the showy ramonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenia. The plant is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or wetland habitats. Ramonia pulchella is often found in clusters, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered fruits.
